Sparkling light amber body with big off-white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, molasses, caramel, some toasty.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, molasses, light earthy, faint herbal.  Finish has very mild bitterness.  Light-medium body with a hint of stickiness.  Ok, but a bit too sweet to me.
Poured amber/orange with a medium white head.  Spicy, malty aroma.  Taste is maltier than other oktoberfests I have with pumpkin spice and a slight hint of hops.  Very drinkable and smooth.

Amber colored with a small head and light carbonation. Delightful aroma-barley, bread, caramel, slightly  toasty. Medium bodied, round, sweet caramel malty flavor with a good underlying hoppiness, slightly fruity with plum and toffee notes.  Medium finish, dryish, refined, a superb Ofest.

I had this last night on Draft at a Octoberfest party. Unfortunately I had to drink it out a plastic cup but really didnt mind because it was free and pretty damn tasty! 
 Poured a nice shadowy amber body and a cream colored head. The senses noted sweet suggestions of somewhat smoky molasses, plums, apricots raisins, but mostly notes of toffee and caramel. Truly picked up on a large dose of brown sugar A very drinkable Marzen.
got this as sample in a beer store in ct.  brown color.  raisiny nose.  watery, nutmeg flavor.   thank goodness it was free
Very well done. Malts and hops are in a very good balance. Nice body... not at all watery or metallic like Spaten.

Amber color, with a lacey, tannish head. Highly aromatic : spicy, cloves, cinnamon, herbal. Malty, but not overmuch. Some sweetness, but, again, just enough. Delicate hop, solid body, slight sharpness and a coppery edge in the mouthfeel. Very delicious.
Amber color with a long lasting medium white head.  Clear.  Lots of lacing.  Malty aroma.  Not too sweet.  Some caramel flavor.  Malty but again not sweet.  Medium body.  crisp nice

Clear amber body, medium clumping off-white head.  Spicy hops aroma with faint metallic notes.  Malty, toasty body with caramel and earthy hops; metallic and biscuity finish.  Clean mouthfeel.  One of the better Oktoberfests Ive sampled of late.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Light amber coloured with a moderate sized off-white head. Sweet malty aroma with some caramel and perhaps a bit of fruit. Nice taste; sweet, malty and a bitter hop finish. Smooth, medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Good beer.
Pretty good and not quite as malty as some of the other Oktoberfest brews that I have tried.  Drinkable and decent, but not a favorite of mine.  Go for the wheat beer.

I want to give it a great rating...  But the hefe weiss is SO much better.  I got a lot of this for a good price to boot during Oktoberfest,  but its really just a golden, foamy pedestrian beer.  A real shame!

Dark copper with virtually no head.  Aroma was dominated by roasted caramel malts typical for this style, but there was also some fruitiness to add some diversity.  Smooth palate with modest carbonation and a toasty, slighly sweet, taste.  Just enough hops to notice that they are there.

Bottled. Good dark color for a modern German Okto. A little bit lighter in malt character, but it more than makes up for it in a nice hoppy nose. There are some melanoidins in the bigger malt bill, and a little sourness. Also note a bit of hard water which helps bring out the hops.

This brew has a great palate - creamy smooth, small bubbles of carbonation make it seem thicker than it actually is.  Taste is caramel sweet - but not overly so, an obvious hop balance helping out here.

On tap.  Amber/orangy color with good sized white head.  Aroma is sweet malt with molasses and caramel.  Taste is toasted malt and a bit sweet.  Finish is hoppy enough to balance the sweet malt.  This is the best october Ive had this season.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2004 (tap) this was some good stuff, among my favorite oktoberfest beers ive tasted. dry and crisp, drinkable and unique, everything i love about fall but not overly spicey... i will be ordering this again and again this season.
Poured oragne/amber, like leaves of fall.  Light head. Pleasant dry flavor. Good hop finish. I loved this beer.
Light copper in color, with moderate white head that disappears quickly.    Malty sweet aroma.  Medium bodied, with good malt background and a decent hop bitterness that keeps it from being cloying.
A benchmark for Oktoberfest beers.  Sweet malty aroma and taste that is the trademark of Oktoberfest beers.  Goes down smooth.  Easy to drink in responsible celebratory quantities.

Smooth medium body lager. Great fall
marzen for watching football! One of your better Hacker brews.

Poured a copper color with a small off white head and light lacing on the glass.  Toasted dough, dry grains, and very light sweet caramel malts in the aroma.  I would have liked the aroma a little sweeter.  Flavor was also dry and lightly smokey, but the caramel and honey stood stronger here than in the aroma.  A light hoppiness comes through at the end, with medium carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2005 Dark golden color with fairly high carbonation. Aroma is toasty and malty. Light and crisp flavor with a toasted, nutty malt flavor. Easy to drink. After re-rating, there is a lot of sweet malty flavor in this one that many are lacking. It is turning into a favorite.

12 oz bottle: spicy hop aromatics, with honey, caramel and floral notes.  Interesting fruity flavour, with nuts, candied malts and figs.  The palate is even: smooth with some nice carbonation, and finishes with enough flavour to keep me coming back.  Fair and tasty.

In my opinion this is the best marzen made.  It has the nicest balance of malt and hops going.  The beer is incredibly drinkable.  The malt aroma is straight from the brew kettle.  Caramel throughout. I think this is a classic and have found no American micro that can touch it, though several Germans come close.

Copper color with a good size off white head. Sweet malt aroma with hints of
yeast. Slightly sweet malt flavor with a
touch of caramel. A little light on the palate, but a very drinkable beer.
Poured an orangey color with a mild 1 finger head. Mild sweet malt and very subtle caramel in nose. Flavor was a somewhat watery version of aroma. Nothing outstanding but a pretty good session beer.

12 oz. brown, longneck bottle. Freshness date of 03.05 on lower right front label. Poured out a beautiful amber color, with a minimal orangish copper head to it. Aromas right away were of fresh malts, yeasty bread, slight biscuit notes, and a earthy hoppiness to it.
Tastes are of faint fruitiness, malts, yeast, and a slight hops bite at the end. Medium mouthfeel, doesnt coat your tongue like some other beers. Finishes crisp and dry, with a lingering maltiness to it.
A decent Octoberfest if ever there was one.

I found this very enjoyable. Nice reddish color, nice subtle honey aroma.  A little thin on the mouth as others have noted, but it seems to help it go down easier, as if it were meant to be consumed in large quantities at some kind of festival.  Hm.  Also a pleasant reminder that Fall is on its way
Bottle - sweet malt aroma - slight honey.  Great red caramel color.  Sweet malt flavor with only a bit of bitterness to finish.  A nicely balanced beer.
Pours a caramel color with a small head that dissapears quickly. Slightly hoppy with a note of caramel. Overall a very good beer that Ill have to try again.

Bottle pours a vibrant orange, small white head that quickly dies down to a thin film, so-so lacing, with light carbonation.   Sweet grass and oats on the nose.   Malts and light nuts on the tongue.   Light body, very little mouthfeel.   Finishes quick, with only a trace of sweet malts.   A very light & boring Oktoberfest.

Dark amber color with a lasting creamy head. Malt and caramel nose with a roasty note. Malted flavor, with hints of vanilla and almond. Smooth light carbonation, somewhat oily with a bitter finish. Great looking beer but a bit disappointing at the finish.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2011 My least favorite beer from this company. +++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a caramel color with a large creamy beige head that lingered. The aroma was lightly malty and hoppy. The flavor was sour vegetable and some malt with a bitter and slightly skunky finish. Drain poured.

A pleasant beer.  Poured a dark amber with a beige head.  aroma revealed some malt, caramel, molasses, and a whiff of smoke.  Mouthfeel was unremarkable.  Watery.  SLight carbonation.  The flavor was decent.  Had a nice maltiness and sweet candy essense with that subtle touch of smoke.  Not bad.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2009 Bottle:  Aroma is malty with a mixture of caramel, banana, toastiness, and earthiness.  It pours a transparent amber with a one-inch white head that fizzes out somewhat quickly.  The flavor starts with moderate caramel and light toffee.  The finish has moderate toastiness with some herbal and earthy bitterness.   Light-medium bodied with very mild carbonation that leaves the mouthfeel feeling a bit thin at times.  Its okay, but my tastes have changed quite a bit since my original rating.  What was once my favorite style, Im now finding a bit boring.  My original rating was 7-4-7-3-16.

Watery, thin amber/orange body with a buttercream, big bubbled head. Smells malt and german hops. Taste is bitter German hops, butterscotch, malt, berries, bread (doughy). Malty flavor makes for a very nice drinking Octoberfest beer. Not necessarily the greastest taste and depth of flavor, but just an easy drink that could be had by the dozen.
Pours bright amber...smells of caramel and toffee...tastes malty and caramel too...finishes bitter...not a great example...
Bottle. Burnt caramel bitter taste. Finsh is bitter. Whole thing is bitter.
Pours copper with almost no head. Acidic toffee and caramel taste. Carbonated but no head makes me think this is infected.

Bottle.  Dark amber reddish color with a light foamy tan head and lots of rising bubbles.  A delightly sweet fruit and rich malt aroma with mollasses.  A malty caramel flavor that is both smooth and thick.  Much better than expected.

Tap. pours an amber color with a frothy head. aroma is sweet witha toffee hint. taste is very sweet, but not overpowering. very refreshing. nice enjoyable finish. not a bad brew. finish is bit more bitter, but does not take away from the overall quality of this beer.
Amber Coloring.  Caramel. Malt.  Had at O.C.  Not a bad  Oktoberfest Beer.  Worth keeping a bottle.
Poured amber, with good head and lacing.  Aroma of malt, toffee, caramel.  Tastes malty, with some caramel, brown sugar, and toffee in the finish.  Also a slight hop presence at the end.
Pretty good beer. Pours a nice medium amber with a good off-whtie head. Kinda weak aroma that I couldnt grab on to. Smooth metallic taste, good amount of hops. Def a good brew.

poured a nice deep amber big fluffy off white head. aroma citrus,  yeasty, fruity. flavor caramel,hints of malts and choc. finish was very pleasant nice dryness with a very slight bitterness. good beer

Interesting stuff. Here at this one bar the only thing that they have that is slightly drinkable is this stuff. The only down side is that I have NO IDEA how long it has been in their fridge. In fact every bottle that I get from them has just a hint of funk to it? Maybe it was not stored correctly over the long time that they have had it in their coolers. But underneath there is definately something good. Hints of caramel and alcohol. The taste is smoothe with lots of malts. Pretty darn good I must say.
Very excited to try this very highly touted Marzen. Huge billoughy head out of the bottle. Amber color. Hoppy and smooth. Full flavored beer. Excellent Oktoberfest. Im glad I had this.

Very attractive reddish to copper color.  Not overly heavy or complex, but more than enough malty sweetness, mouthfeel and nose to do the style well - especially for a bottled brew.  Easily  drinkable.  No lingering after tastes.
Sweet, light, malty aroma; lively carbonation, but dissipating head; very smooth and rather mild flavor with a toast/bread sweetness and back end light bitterness; very nice!

My bottle reads "Original Oktoberfest." A simple beer but nicely flavored. Good malty flavors of caramel and nuttiness balanced nicely with a slightly bitter citric hop presence. Easy to drink. Hacker-Pschorrs year-round Oktoberfest offering is indeed a good one.
Pours a small white head, decent lacing.  Red/amber coloring.  Aroma is sweet.  Taste is malty with a subtle fade to the Hallertau.
red-amber color with a thin tan head; the taste is somewhat acidic, but with barely any bitterness; not as spicy as other Oktoberfests

Outstanding brew! Nothing over the top or WOWing, but overall just a supurb brew. Pours an amber color with a medium head. Sweet malty arome and a mild malt flavor that washes away smooth and softly. This would be a great session beer.

Amber; refined, articulate head. Buttermilk biscuits, butter and honey in the aroma. Spicy bitteness in the flavor with slightly agglutinated malt stickiness. Concise  yeast snippets with a very light touch of diacetyl. Delicious and sophisticated.

Amber hue with small head and minimal lace. The aroma hints of bread and biscuit, toasted malts, light caramel, honey, aromatic hops, and orange/apple fruit. The taste starts of sweet bread and caramel malt. A does of biiterness and acidic nature follows, a touch fruity. The finish is muddled and too short for style. Some bitterness but doesn't shine. The mouthfeel is smooth and refreshing enough. A good beer but lacks any standout characteristic.

Small offwhite head,poof! Gone in a flash. No lacing to speak of. Clear amber/orange color. Malty, dusty nose, doughy. Medium body. Medium sweet malt flavors, breadyness. Finish is medium sweet. An unoffensive, clean drinkin lager.
Redish color with a thin white head.  A little bit of hop aroma mixed in with rich maltiness.  A tiny hint of bitterness in the taste is quickly overcome by the malt flavors.
On tap at Summits Wayside Tavern-Poured a redish color with a nice thick head...Some nice caramel tones accompanied by some maltiness that was overall very nicely balanced.  A good Marzen.

Pleasent malty and bread aroma. Appearance is a reddish orange with little head. Flavor is well rounded with a slight bitterness to accompany the sweet flavor. There is some caramel and citrus in there. A little less flavor than some Marzens Ive had but a good example of the style.
Bottle: drinkable , a bit watery though the malts were full and sweet. I would like to try this on tap.
Lightly bitter. Crisp flavor.  Amber clear color with nice white head.  Very carbonated.  Nice palate.
an inviting red hugh and mild aroma compl1ment its sweet caramel taste a very good octoberfest

this marzen-- tasted, prodded and lovingly scrutenized beside a penn oktoberfest and a lakefront riverwest stein vienna-- was a chestnut-copper hued sample and it scored a quick aromatic sound-byte with it's earthy composting leaf-liter malts.  i dutifully noted it's ample endowment of sesame colored foam, ebbing downward like a sudsy aurora borealis, but it clamored to be recognised not for it's skin-deep appearance, but for it's richly baked oven-pan malts and unique hallertau hoppiness.  i've tasted enough beers to appreciate the fundamental "german-ness" of the aroma, but i'm no engineer of zymurgy-- so i can't say exactly why that's so: it's caramel and orange, sweet, with more hops in the aroma than the finish, light to medium bodied--somehow  it's very german. and for a lager, that's a very good place to be.

A very nice and easy to drink Oktoberfest style beer.  A dark amber color, with a bit of residual lacing and a tiny head.  Very medium-bodied and true to the style, rich with lots of caramel notes and a bitter hoppiness in the finish.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2004 My favorite of this style. Even dig the labeling. I get tired of this style after a while though--starts to taste like beer just to drink to get drunk on, that is, loses its complexity after a few bottles. Okay for a seasonal change, though, and this is truly representational of the style. If I'm after Oktoberfest bier, I'll choose this. The big difference, I think, is in the palate--definitely a bigger, chewier mouthful than the rest.
Nice amber with tan head. Lovely malt aromas. Sweetish malt flavors with almost no hops. An excellent O-fest.

My third favorite Oktoberfest of the year. Warm, round malty flavor. A little lacking in the hops department, but so is pretty much all beer. It made me want more, which I suppose is the true test  of any beer.

Dark ruby mahogany color with light head and moderate carbonation. Aroma is sweet with maltiness and light hops. Flavor has beautiful layers of malts with the hops coming in the end as a desert. Finishes lightly dry and quenching but the flavor still remains. This was a good oktoberfest worthy of than just one occasion.

I thought this beer was rather ordinary.  It has a clear golden amber color with a foamy head.  The aroma was pretty weak with a little bit of malty sweetness.  It went down very smoothly, but the flavor was extremely mild consisting of mostly malt overtones.  The finish was more of the same.  Overall it was a decent beer, but nothing about it stood out.

im assuming this is considered the "orginal oktoberfest" It seemed kind of light too me for an oktoberfest.  It had sweet caramel malty notes to it but it seemed rather watered down. had a nice appearane too me

Amber colour with a super-dense tan head-perfect for the style. Very pleasant aroma of caramel, malt, spices and a slight grapeyness. Medium-bodied; Sweet initial flavour covered by a great malt background-once again great for the style! Aftertaste shows grapes, caramel, malt and a few spices. Overall, one of the best Marzens i've ever had! Worth a try! I bought my twelve ounce bottle at the Opera House Gourmet in Manassas, Virginia and sampled it on 27-Novemeber-2003.

Nicer amber color and long lasting white head.   Not only was the appearance appealing, but the sweet/roasted flavor was enjoyable. I was given this beer by a friend whose Ukranian father had passed away.   He enjoyed the European lagers, so thanks to Iwan for this Oktoberfest and may you rest in peace.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2011 Bottle.  Pours clear tawny with a small, fizzy white head, short retention and faint lacing.  Aroma is toasted caramel and biscuit malt, light to medium melanoidins, light spicy hops, and a clean lager character.  Flavor is malt dominant with light sweetness and tea-like character, light fruity notes, mild hops, and a clean, dry finish.  Medium body, light warmth, medium carbonation.
Clear copper color. Lasting head. Aroma full of caramel, spice, and malt. Smooth taste. Not too bad! I could drink this again.
Clear, amber coloring with a light tan head.  Sweet caramel malt aroma.  Smooth malt sweetness (just a bit of caramel).  Aftertaste is mildly malty, slightly metallic.
Deep amber hue. Roasted malt aromas follow through with nice caramel malt flavors and some fruity notes. Finishes with more malt flavors, and a touch of dry herbal bitterness for balance.
Nice balance, even when warm.  Roasty but sweet and not bitter.  Good fruit and caramel, mmm.

ok.  i'm not a big fan of the style.  malty, yet astringently sweet as i find most oktoberfest beers.  i couldn't drink more than one w/out a stomach ache.  not gag-me bad, not tickle-me incredible.  just more of a hug-me, everything is going to be ok.

Deep, orange-red in color.  Scent of nutmeg.  Has a weird taste like dried blood; metallic, dry, salty, coppery.  With all these elements it is still smooth and the malt flavors come through nicely.  Although the initial taste is like sucking on a penny!

Copper amber color with a good frosty tan head, that settled down leaving a good lace on top.  Floral malty aroma.  Caramel malt up front, but I felt the finish was thin and light leaving me wanting more.
UPDATED: OCT 20, 2004 Delicious Oktoberfest, I had this one for free from a great bartender at Stuff Yer Face. Thanks Tony.  This is right up there with Paulaner.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2004 Pours dark amber with tall beige head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is sweet malts, apples, and pears.  Flavor is the same with very little carbonation and a smooth finish. A delicious Oktoberfest with a good alcohol kick.  A little too syrupy sweet for me, but seems true to the style.  Slight metallic taste.  Quite tasty overall.
Color is brownish/amber.  Good malt balance on the nose and taste.  Hint of caramel?  Good Oktoberfest.

This is very well balanced for a lager, but especially an Oktoberfest (looking at the commercial description that doesn't seem so surprising anymore). The color is unique, the mouthfeel is without flaw, and the nose is very concise. I had quite a few of these over the Oktoberfest season, and I never got bored. Just plain good.
Amber/orange body, no head.  Little aroma.  Sweet malty flavor, smooth finish.
Clear amber with little head.  Aroma and flavor is of munich/vienna malt with a crisp finish.  Good example of an Octoberfest.

POurs a brownish amber. with a medium tan head. Noe is malted with hint of spice. The tongue is predominantly malt but adds a little more complexity to it with a little spiciness and and light hops. Finishes well and is a pretty good beer.

Good amber color,small head that lasted for a short time.Malty sweet aroma with hints of caramel,and maybe mild fruit.Malty,caramel taste,medium sweet and faintly hopped.The after taste is mild being mostly malt and caramel with little else going on.This is an OK brew but nothing special.

Deep amber, nice frothy cream head. Smells sweet, like apples, and spices, malty, even alcohol. The flavor is surprisingly light to me but a great burnt marshmallow flavor, toffee, with a little hops bitterness. This is the best Oktoberfest I have had the chance to try. It has great flavor and is one of the better Hacker-Pschorrs. Smooth finish. Awesome.

One of the few true O'fests left. Not watered down to meet the perceived tastes of the majority of attendees, Americans. Beautiful amber-gold, crystal clear, with a pure white head. Nice aroma of toasted malt, with hints of honey. Aroma is a little faint. Great malty/toasted flavor, with a firm but gentle noble hop backbone. Fades to a great balance in the tail...leaving only one thought: MORE!

Totally clear amber.Rising carbonation and a great,tan,head. Excellent grainy/malty aroma(caramel,toasted malt,)with the slightest spice,from hops. If anything is wrong here,the mouthfeel is way to fizzy. Pretty big body,perfect texture. Clean,malty flavors. Grainy,toasty,fruity,flaovrs with a touch of hops before the finish. Finish is bready and caramel,with spicy hallertau notes. Well balanced and clean,but a bit too fizzy. Still,probably my favorite Oktoberfest so far.
(Bottle) Pours an amber color with a thick, frothy white head.  Well-balanced medium-bodied beer with hints of carmel.

Crystal clear lager. The color is the very definition of amber. Medium-sized, fizzy, off-white head. I really like this Oktoberfest!
An entire hive of clover honey in the aroma. Lightly perfumey and smokey as well.
Well-balanced, malty brew with notes of caramel and honey with whispers of citrus fruit.
Medium-bodied with an oily mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Crisp, clean finish.

Appearance: This pours absolutely crystal clear amber color with a two fingered white head that quickly disappears.
Aroma: The nose is nice and malty with a touch of sweetness.
Flavor: It's slightly bitter upfront but finishes malty. 

This is a very nice O'fest beer.
A heavy-bodied deep amber lager. Rich and malty, almost to the level of a bock. Probably a bit too much, for my liking. Still, much better than Spaten.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2005 Man, this is solid. I finally picked up a fresh bottle and this is tasting good. Caramel malts and those somewhat spicy metallic German hops. Balanced very nicely. Smooth and clean on the palate.
Orange color with a medium sized tan head. Malty scent. A nice caramel taste is there, but has an awful metallic aftertaste behind it, spoiling an otherwise very nice beer.

12 oz bottle, lager mug, bbf 7/04, 58 degrees.  Gigantic, rocky, frothy, off-white head is on a clear, orange-amber body with light carbonation.  Huge malty aroma is primarly caramel and nutty; very light flowery hops; slight butter / toffee aroma.  Very clean aroma.  Flavor is warm and sweet just like the aroma.  Moderately sweet throughout with a lightly bitter, lightly acidic finish.  Medium body, watery texture, light carbonation.  The bottom line is: realy good, but not as vibrant as Ayinger's offering.
Clear copper color.Malty aroma. Decent hoppy taste in the mouth. Malty creamy finish with a hint of bitterness. A pretty good Marzen!

Decent creamy off-white head from the pour.  Plesant aroma of malts and some fresh bread.  Color is a medium amber with ok carbonation.  Flavor is quite nice with more malts and is soft and fuzzy in the mouth.  Finish is creamy and smooth with a lingering malts and hops aftertaste.  A decent beer.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2005 Draft.  Coppery color, some malts, decent hop bitterness to balance, some floral notes.  A decent Okto, which isnt my favorite style, but I liked this better than most.  1/20/05 - sampled a bottled version.  Hops went all vegetal, off-putting aroma, not at all good.  I would have rated this a 2.  Stick with the draft version by all means.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2007 10/1/07: Re-rate. Bottle. Dated 02/07, so likely past its prime. Molasses malt aroma. Not my favorite. Crystal clear amber with steady visible carbonation. Head disappates to nothing. Like I said, could be age of brew or glassware that wasnt cleaned properly. Doesnt taste past its prime. Very malty, but moderate sweetness and ample carbonation contribute to making this an enjoyable brew. Ar 6, Ap 2, Fl 7, Pal 4, Ov 13. 9/2203: Cookie and malt aroma. Clear brownish/amber color with white, fully eroding head. Good O-Fest but a little overly malty. Despite the downgrade Goose Islands O-Fest has undergone in its progressively more malty profile, it still edges out H-Ps.
Still a Fest Favorite. A malt lover's dream. Rich Munich flavor. But I had a Ramstein recently alongside the Hacker and thought Ramstein was better.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Pours a clear copper, with a small off-white head that quickly diminshes, but leaves good lace all the way down.  Aroma is all malt, mostly caramel and some toasted malts.  Flavor is fairly sweet, some toasted/maybe a bit smokey flavors, and some slight chocolate sneaking in at the end.  Medium body, medium carbonation.
Her appearance is average, ruby orange in color, she failed to shave her pits.  Her taste includes a slight hint of pumpkin carmel...Her snatch is a little bland...Overall she is solid.
nice amber color, pleasant aroma. Love the taste down to the last drop. I have to as one of my new favorites.

My favorite regular 'fest brew. Maybe its the nostaglia of picking up a real German beer. Sweet aroma over a nice dark amber color. Yeastiness in the tongue counters the sweetness of the malts and then along comes a great hopped finish. Perfect for the style.
Nice amber-reddish dark color. A sweet malt ,maybe some roasted nut aroma. Still typical malty in the flavor with some fruity, raisin notes. A good Oktoberfest selection.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2006 Pours a light orange-red with some small but nice looking beige-white head.  Smells wonderful, I love hallertau.  Also can smell some crisp yeast aroma.
Starts out mildly malty, an even earthy malt arising from the barley.  The middle of the body dries out some and there is some hops flavor here.  Little acidity throughout.  The body is medium and to my delight, this beer is not watery. Alcohol adds some warm light caramel flavor late and the beer finishes with a clean crisp nutty hops flavor.  I will admit the flavor does thin out somewhat towards the finish, but I enjoy the unique flavors created by the dry hops and barley mixed with a warm alcohol/caramel flavor.  Again, if it is this good in the bottle in America, this must be incredible in Germany on tap. I can only dream and wait patiently.  I wish they didnt make this filtered in the bottle. . .

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2008 It is usually a good beer, but I had it last night, and it had a off taste to it.  It was not as good as it usually is. <b> nice beer this time around.  Bottle. Malty and hoppy. Well balanced. <b> Had this again last night. Very nice. Bottle at the Goldhawk in Hoboken. Clean tasting. Malty and caramel flavor. Hoppy notes. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2005 Sept, 2003 Deeply malty aroma. Its right down there at the bottom of the barrel, all sticky and gooey and black and dripping and throbbing with gristle and cracked sinews and the sweat from a builders arse. It pulsates with the sexual energy of a randy gorilla on viagra. This malt has got hairy balls and the libido of a Ferrari. Its a kick-ass, crome-plated, fuel-injected, world-champion deep diving, chest-thumping, ever-loving shaguar of a malt aroma. And all rather spoiled by the metallic hops the Germans seem to love so much. Ah well. The taste is good - a creamy caramel in a body that just tiptoes teetering on the brink under the wire of decent for just enough time for the watery finish to really piss you off. The sweet malt returns nicely in the finish - not with any great range of flavours, but just there as a sweet malt should be - kinda cute, kinda simple, hair all nicely curled and with an innocent smile. The earthy hops come in a little stronger (theyve been there all the time, hovering decently above it all, not intrusive, just letting you know that the sweet malt is not going to have it all its way) - and when those hops come in late theres just a moment of cringing. How much youll like this will depend on how much you like those earthy but metallic hops, and how much you like your malt to play a simple sweet game. I liked it. I didnt think it was a GREAT beer, but it was tasty enough. [3.3]
Oct, 2005: Bottle. Not offensive. Quite malty. Quite hoppy. [2.9]

A very nice orange/amber color and tan head start this one.  Nose is malty, delicious, and superb!  The flavor is nice as well, with a very nice malt character, but can't quite live up to the nose.  However, this is a great Oktober...very well crafted!

(bottled) Rich malt aroma and brilliantly clear dark amber color.  Wonderful toasty caramel malt presence with a plum fruit note and a lightly bitter hoppiness.  Lingering sweet raisin finish.  Superb!

Fresh caramelmalt and bitterhop nose.
Amber/cherrytree looks, lowish creamy head.
Carame and malt flavors prevail - also some sharper edges like in the Hubertus bock - though much lighter and easier to drink. 
This beer is more like a Vienna than any of the other Marzen I have tasted so far.

This beer pours a nice amber color with a large creamy head that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass.  The aroma is of roasted malts and sweet also.  The taste is fairly smooth and I has hints of caramel with sweetness and some light spices as well.  Solid taste.  Very well representative of the style.  Not a bad beer.

Color is a clear amberish brown, with a nice head of light tannish colored foam with good clingy lacing. Smells quite good, nice roasty malt with some spices and herbs hinting in the back and a oily fresh hoppiness. Taste is roasted, malty sweet with a little toffee and dry spice notes. Its soft in the hops with a well rounded balance thats very smooth and slighty silky/buttery. Feel is solid, full, medium body, nice and smooth and rich, super nice silky malt feel and flavor and has a good dry, spiced hop kick in the finish, with no overwhelming characters anywhere to be found. This is one very nice Oktoberfest beer.
On tap. One of my favorite German breweries.  This is how an Oktoberfest beer should taste.  If you like them sort of thick and caramelly, you'll like this one.  If you don't, then...

This beer had a sort of blood or metallic like hint of a taste I couldn't quite taste and seemed to disappeared as I drank more. This is an OK beer, and good to try once, but there is not distinguishing or special about it and I would not get it again.

I got this stuff at an Italian resturant, which was kind of strange.  But anyway, I couldn't really tell how it looked because they served it to me in a ceramic mug.  This might have affected the taste too.  It was nice tasiting up until the finish.  There was a distinct metallic taste in it.  Otherwise, I really enjoyed it, but didnt really go with the pizza I had.
Amber coloured with a sweet but not sickly taste.The head dissapeared quickly and there was little aftertaste. Not so much body as some other Marzens but overall not a bad drink.

Nicemalty, yeasty aroma - with a bit of an unidentified vegetable odor thrown in for good measure. Light head - little to no lacing.  Appealing orange appearance - could be a tad darker though.  Very malty flavor - sticks to your ribs.  Goes down smooth with a strong finish. Overall a great representation of the style.
A nice amber color with a medium head.  Slight spice aroma with a slight spice version of a vienna.  A good autumn beer.
Bottled. Thin off white head sits atop a coppery orange brew. Slightly carmel aroma with a  very sweet malt upfront, almost sour yeastyness and a crisp  Hallertau finish.
Aroma of corn syrup and sugar, with a smooth palate and mild yeast and malt tastes.  Overall has a nice sweet texture.

Good hops flavor, very clean and crisp. Nice amber color with nice head. Had out of the bottle and it didn't come through overly sweet. I am a big fan of Marzens and Hallertau hops, which has the dryness and spiciness that I love. This was a very pleasing beer.

Fine, but I prefer the Oktoberfest I recently had at Titletown in Green Bay.

thin bodied....everything about this beer was METALLIC. the color--copper. the aroma--tin. the taste--aluminum, albeit somewhat malted/smoked aluminum. i had such high hopes for this beer! alas, i would not buy this again.

I have to join the ranks of the few who thought this a disappointment.  The spurt of maltiness, accompanied by a tinge of metallic bitterness and palate-jarring acidity, doesnt add much to an otherwise plain-jane lager aroma.  Pours a nice head (over a strange color) but that goes quickly and leaves a slightly limp body.  Not a beer to which I would return soon.
Bright copper color and a sweet malty body.  This beer is very well balanced with a light bitterness and a smooth finish.  A fine representative of the Oktoberfest style.

(OCBP) Tasting, amber color,decnt malt flavour,somewhat bitter, decent choice.
clear amber color, light spiced aroma.  Very nice rich palate, sweet, some spices.  Very nicely balanced beer.

Deep gold color, large head, kind of creamy. Spicy malty aroma. A medium bodied marzen. Malty and slightly spicy. Touch of smoke/toast. Nice flavored marzen. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is crisp and a little dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Nice beer.

Nice appearance, malty aroma. Very drinkable octoberfest. This is a top notch brew. I would drink again.
This is my benchmark for all other Octoberfests and so far, I havent found anything as good.  Caramel flavor and just the right amount of malt to make for a very drinkable beer.

Briliant clear orange amber color with a thick head.  Caramel and toast flavors in the malt. The old 0.5l bottles still have more flavor than the new 12 oz. bottles.  Still one of the top ten oktoberfests.  Finish in bitter enough to cut though all the malt.  A good fall brew.

It is a bit lighter in body than a few of the others, which isnt a bad thing if you are gulping down a liter or two.  It isnt the most flavorful, but it is the most drinkable.

beer.
One of my favourite Oktoberfest/Märzen. Full-bodied and malty.
Enticing sweet creamy aroma certainly gives a fair indication of the sweeter palate. Weak chocolate notes and malt fruitiness hold up well against a dry walnut finish. Pretty tasty for this style.

Delicious - dark amber body and sweet caramel aroma. Strong presence of hops make it crisp, dry and refreshing with almost a Pilsener-like finish. Kind of mild compared to other Oktoberfest brews Ive had, but a great brew all the same.
A phenomenal beer that any beer lover would enjoy!  I really cant say enough about the quality of this beer but I would say it is the best out of the tap.  So sit back and enjoy this fine brew.

Nice carmel color. The mild roasting of the barley really gives this a nice aroma. This beer really makes me appreciate the great Marzen of Sudwerk. What a great job they did with this traditional German style. These two are nearly identical. This is only my second beer of this style and I am really looking forward to trying more!

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2003 The beer pours a perspicuous burnished copper color, the head mountainous in size, spumescent in texture, the color a beauteous light tan and as it disjoins the lace forms a concealing sheet upon the glass. The aroma of sweet malted grain greets you first, then a bit of molasses, crisp and clean, a treat for the eyes and the nose, start is quite sweet, thickly malt with the top middling in its feel to the palate. Finish is lenient in its acidity, the hops pleasantly mild in their spiciness, dry and lingering aftertaste, quite a quaffable brew tis true.

Loved the copper color and creamy head - made my mouth yearn for the first sip. And I have to say, I wasnt disappointed. Somewhat fruity aroma, with sweet, rich, and complex malt flavors exuding throughout your mouth. One of the tastiest Oktoberfests I can recall. Its tantalizing. And the zingy flavors just reeled me in... and I swallowed the hook further.
This is the one that I try to keep around, I really enjoy the flavor.

Slight red-tinge in this beautifully headed amber. Lovely doppelbock-like rich roasted malt aroma, however, the taste is just ordinary. The beer is a tad too light and has a slight bitter undercurrent. An okay oktoberfest, but uneven.

This beer is brewed with Bavarian barley that has been slow roasted and caramelized to a rich, red amber color. Therefore, the beer itself pours with an amber/copper color and a thick, foamy head. The water used in the beer production is from the purest spring waters from the Alps. The yeast used is a centuries old, exclusive product of the brewery. Only the finest Bohemian Hallertau hops are used to give the beer it gentle bitter finish. This beer has fruity malt accents with a hint of spice. The beer has a moderate amount of carbonation that make for a lively mouthfeel. The finish, as I said, is gently bitter. This beer is very similar in taste to it cousin, also from München: Spaten Oktoberfest Ur Märzen.
Rich flavored amber style Oktoberfest beer.  Uniques flavors that made this a unique and pleasent beer.

great full flavored oktoberfest. not too hoppy, just right. EXCELLENT flavor.
